title: Redesign team member images with glassmorphic theme, suitable sizing, and enhancement

requirements.summary: Redesign both team member profile images with glassmorphic frame, consistent sizing (200Ã—200px square), rounded corners, and glowing border matching the dark futuristic glassmorphism theme
acceptanceCriteria: Both team member photos (Naveen V and Saarumathi A) are displayed at a consistent, suitable size within a glassmorphic frame.
The image container uses backdrop-blur, semi-transparent background, and a glowing or frosted border consistent with the app's glassmorphic design system.
Images have rounded corners and do not appear stretched or cropped awkwardly.
The fallback initials avatar also inherits the same glassmorphic styling.
The carousel layout remains functional and responsive after the redesign.

file_operations.description: Wrap each member's photo/avatar in a glassmorphic container div applying backdrop-blur-md, bg-white/5 or bg-black/20 semi-transparent background, border border-white/20, rounded-2xl corners, and a neon-glow-cyan or similar glowing box-shadow. Set the img element to a consistent square size (e.g., w-[200px] h-[200px] or w-48 h-48) with object-cover to prevent stretching. Apply the same glassmorphic styling to the fallback initials avatar container. Ensure the carousel's directional animation and navigation logic remain intact.

requirements.summary: Enhance team member profile images with CSS-level brightness boost, contrast increase, and subtle inner glow or drop-shadow for a more vibrant and polished appearance
acceptanceCriteria: Team member photos appear visually enhanced (brighter, higher contrast) compared to plain rendering.
A subtle glow or shadow effect is applied to the image element or its container.
Enhancements are consistent for both members.
Enhancements do not degrade readability of surrounding text or UI elements.

file_operations.description: Apply inline or Tailwind utility classes to the img element: brightness-110 contrast-110 (or filter: brightness(1.1) contrast(1.1)) to boost vibrancy. Add drop-shadow-lg or a custom shadow-[0_0_20px_rgba(0,255,255,0.3)] to create a subtle glow around the image. Ensure the enhancements apply to both members' photos consistently and do not interfere with the glassmorphic frame or carousel functionality.
